meanings.definition: The quality of being attractively lively and animated.
meanings.sent1: Her vivacity lit up the room with her infectious energy.
meanings.sent2: The children's laughter and vivacity filled the playground with joy.
meanings.sent3: Her vivacity was so contagious that even the grumpiest person couldn't help but smile.
meanings.sent4: The vivacity of the bustling city streets was like a symphony of movement and sound.
meanings.sent5: The vivid vivacity of the flowers in full bloom painted a colorful scene in the garden.

meanings.definition: The power of attracting or holding the attention; liveliness.
meanings.sent1: The singer's vivacity on stage captivated the audience's hearts.
meanings.sent2: The vivid colors of the painting added vivacity to the otherwise dull room.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's vivacity made it impossible for anyone to ignore his playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The vivacity of the debate kept the audience engaged and eager for more.
meanings.sent5: The vivacity of the fireworks display was a dazzling spectacle in the night sky.
